item.title: Apollo and Automation
item.description:
//the beginning of digital flight control//vibe astronautics//the human wants to be in the loop//

Mindell’s Digital Apollo is a great book, and not just for the space-obsessed. Spaceflight was intertwined with the development of cybernetics, modern control systems, and the digital computer. Re-reading it recently while recovering from an illness, I found certain themes especially resonant: specifically, the role of human beings in semi-automated systems, and the nature of human control.
